body.p: Born January 1, 1835 in Adair County, Ky. Admitted to the bar in Adair County. Served as a school commissioner and county attorney. He represented Adair County in the Kentucky Legislature in 1859-61. He married Susan Shelby Magoffin, daughter of Governor Beriah Magoffin. Appointed Secretary of State by his father-in-law, Governor Beriah Magoffin, in October 1861 to replace Thomas B. Monroe who had resigned to join the Confederate Army. In 1862, Gaither himself also resigned to join the Confederate Army and served with the Sixth Kentucky Cavalry CSA. Died on December 19, 1894.
